section.name: Properties of p-values
section.topText: Understanding the properties of p-values allows you to interpret the results of a wide range of hypothesis tests, even if you do not know the details of how the p-values were obtained.
section.page: Hypothesis tests ask whether the sample data are consistent with a statement about the parameters called the null hypothesis.
A p-value is a numerical measure of whether the sample data are consistent with the null hypothesis.
A p-value is the probability of getting such 'extreme' data when the null hypothesis holds.
